sentences.en: But allowing vigilantes to even the score will only lead to a spiral of violence that is hard to stop and inimical to democratic evolution.
sentences.cn: 但是由治安委员会成员来弥补裂痕只能导致暴力事件的盘旋上升，这种事件又是难以遏制的，同时对民主进程又是极其有害的。

sentences.en: Does the food of liver of kidney stone, second have inimical not?
sentences.cn: 肾结石 、 乙肝的饮食有抵触没?

sentences.en: Force is inimical to the laws.
sentences.cn: 武力是与法律不相容的.

sentences.en: If you eat it raw, he suggested deep dipping it in inimical vinegar.
sentences.cn: 如果你直接食用卷心菜, 他建议你可以蘸着点醋来吃.

sentences.en: Listen to this apparent to have no inimical words, spend not intentional wrinkly tight eyebrows to now unfold.
sentences.cn: 听着这句明显没有敌意的话，花无心皱紧的眉头顿时舒展。

sentences.en: The action of calcium as a protective agent inimical ions is not a highly specific function.
sentences.cn: 钙作为一种保护剂以抗御有害离子的作用,并不表现高度的特效性功能.

sentences.en: To the popular mind, science is completely inimical to religion: science embraces facts and evidence while religion professes blind faith.
sentences.cn: 在大众的心目中，科学与宗教完全敌视：科学拥抱事实与证据，而宗教宣示盲目的信仰。

sentences.en: When Krugman repeated one of his "debt is good" posts, posters linked to the economic science from Reinhardt and Rogoff showing that high debt is inimical to economic recovery.
sentences.cn: 当克鲁格曼重复发了一篇他的“举债是美德”博文时，回帖的网民用链接把人们引向了莱因哈特和罗格夫，揭示了巨额债务对经济复苏有害。

trans.tran_cn: 敌意的，有害的，抵触的， 不利的
trans.tran_en: Conditions that are inimical to something make it difficult for that thing to exist or do well
